title: Galio Shield Opinion
body:
I was watching a match about Galio, and the player was discussing with himself the pros and cons of the champion.

I had a thought, what if his passive was similar to Thresh's, but instead of collecting souls, Galio's MR and AP go up X amount of points for every Y amount of spells he absorbs

Sort of encourages support to take spell for the ADC, but I guess a balance would have to be created, any thoughts?

replies.body: i actually like him more as a mid laner so no i dont support the encourage support galio. soz

Huh, actually makes decent sense. I think there is a lot of varied possibilities for Galio if he was to be reworked. His shield is decent, but it could push him into a more full support position if they made it transfer a bit of damage to galio when it was on an ally.

So like the Paladin's Shield item from Terraria, where you absorb some of the damage that is dealt to your teammates.

 I second this, this would make Galio a pretty damn good niche pick for support (At least it does in my head :P).
Shield op worse than thornmail never attack galio or u cry to death. URF was scary af saw an ashe heal galio to full health just with her autos. We lost

Doesn't really work because Galio can just cast the shield on a tank and get stacks. If it was a self cast ability, yeah sure, it may work, but if he was up against someone like Cassiopia, he would gain stacks too fast. He's good as he is atm, doesn't really need much to change
